item.title: Remapping zoom slider on Microsoft Ergonomic Keyboard
item.description: I’m a big fan of Microsoft’s “Natural Ergonomic Keyboard 4000”. I’m just not a fan of it’s name, it’s a mouthful! (How about for future reference we just call it the Ergo?) The Ergo’s great for typing on and also has a selection of feature keys that you can key-map to. Depending on your distro/desktop environment, you can map keys for all sorts of reasons: to replace caps lock with ctrl, control your music player, to run scripts, etc.
